DataElement.preferredName: Prostate Cancer AJCC Edition 8 Pathologic Tumor T Category
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Extent of the primary prostate carcinoma based on clinical stage information combined with operative findings, and evidence obtained from pathology review when surgery is the first definitive therapy, using AJCC Ed. 8 criteria.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Information related to pathologic T stage for prostate tumor.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A gland in the male reproductive system just below the bladder. It surrounds part of the urethra, the canal that empties the bladder. It produces a fluid that forms part of semen. (NCI-GLOSS):(NEE-o-PLAY-zha) Abnormal and uncontrolled cell growth.

Concepts.definition: The walnut shaped accessory sex gland of the male reproductive system. It is located in the pelvis just below the bladder, surrounding the prostatic part of the urethra. The prostate gland secretes a fluid which is part of the semen.

A benign or malignant tissue growth resulting from uncontrolled cell proliferation. Benign neoplastic cells resemble normal cells without exhibiting significant cytologic atypia, while malignant cells exhibit overt signs such as dysplastic features, atypical mitotic figures, necrosis, nuclear pleomorphism, and anaplasia. Representative examples of benign neoplasms include papillomas, cystadenomas, and lipomas; malignant neoplasms include carcinomas, sarcomas, lymphomas, and leukemias.

Property.preferredDefinition: Pathologic; caused by or altered by or manifesting disease or pathology.:One criteria of the TMN staging system.  T refers to the extent of tumor involvement at the primary site (T, followed by a number indicating size and depth of invasion).

Concepts.definition: Caused by or altered by or manifesting disease or pathology.
One criteria of the TNM staging system. T refers to the extent of tumor involvement at the primary site (T, followed by a number indicating size and depth of invasion).

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 9/13/17 tt transferred context; changed def - 1st letter upper case; changed Reg Status to Qualified.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Prostate Carcinoma American Joint Committee on Cancer Edition 8 Pathologic T Category
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A pathologic finding about one or more characteristics of prostate cancer, following the rules of the TNM AJCC v8 classification system as they pertain to staging of the primary tumor. There is no pathologic T1 classification._A group formed for the purpose of developing a system of clinical staging for cancer that is acceptable to the American medical profession and is compatible with other accepted classifications._One criteria of the TNM staging system.  T refers to the extent of tumor involvement at the primary site (T, followed by a number indicating size and depth of invasion)._A grouping of items based on some commonality or by user defined characteristics.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Prostate Cancer pT4 TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Prostate Cancer pT4 TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Prostate cancer in which the tumor is fixed or invades adjacent structures other than seminal vesicles such as external sphincter, rectum, bladder, levator muscles, and/or pelvic wall. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Prostate Cancer pT4 TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Prostate cancer in which the tumor is fixed or invades adjacent structures other than seminal vesicles such as external sphincter, rectum, bladder, levator muscles, and/or pelvic wall. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Prostate Cancer pT3b TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Prostate Cancer pT3b TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Prostate cancer with tumor invading seminal vesicle(s). (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Prostate Cancer pT3b TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Prostate cancer with tumor invading seminal vesicle(s). (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Prostate Cancer pT3a TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Prostate Cancer pT3a TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Prostate cancer with extraprostatic extension (unilateral or bilateral) or microscopic invasion of bladder neck. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Prostate Cancer pT3a TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Prostate cancer with extraprostatic extension (unilateral or bilateral) or microscopic invasion of bladder neck. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Prostate Cancer pT3 TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Prostate Cancer pT3 TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Prostate cancer with extraprostatic extension. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Prostate Cancer pT3 TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Prostate cancer with extraprostatic extension. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Prostate Cancer pT2 TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Prostate Cancer pT2 TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Prostate cancer which is organ confined. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Prostate Cancer pT2 TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Prostate cancer which is organ confined. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A pathologic finding about one or more characteristics of prostate cancer, following the rules of the TNM AJCC v8 classification system as they pertain to staging of the primary tumor. There is no pathologic T1 classification.:A group formed for the purpose of developing a system of clinical staging for cancer that is acceptable to the American medical profession and is compatible with other accepted classifications.:One criteria of the TNM staging system.  T refers to the extent of tumor involvement at the primary site (T, followed by a number indicating size and depth of invasion).:A grouping of items based on some commonality or by user defined characteristics.

Concepts.longName: Prostate Cancer Pathologic Primary Tumor TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: A pathologic finding about one or more characteristics of prostate cancer, following the rules of the TNM AJCC v8 classification system as they pertain to staging of the primary tumor. There is no pathologic T1 classification.
A group formed for the purpose of developing a system of clinical staging for cancer that is acceptable to the American medical profession and is compatible with other accepted classifications.
One criteria of the TNM staging system. T refers to the extent of tumor involvement at the primary site (T, followed by a number indicating size and depth of invasion).
A grouping of items based on some commonality or by user defined characteristics.
